STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 7, 2025
Ashley Whitburn
GOGEBIC/IRON/ONTONAGON DHHS
301 E LEAD ST,
BESSEMER, MI, 49911-1459
RE: License#: CP270201149
Dear Ms. Whitburn:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 05/06/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI. 49684
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(5) An agency shall involve the child’s parent or parents
and the foster parents in the development of service
plans to enable the parent or parents and foster
parents to understand the plan for the child and the
parents’ and the foster parent’s role in assisting the
agency in carrying out the plan. An agency shall give a
copy to and review the parent-agency treatment plan
with the parent or parents and foster parents. The
agency must inform the parent or parents and foster
parent that the information in the parent-agency
treatment plan and any other information about the
child and the child’s family is confidential.
Two of three files reviewed each contained a PATP which was lacking signatures.
CPA Rule 400.12422 Foster care case record
• (3) The record must contain all the following
information:
• (g) A photograph taken at least annually.

One of three files reviewed did not have an updated photograph of the child until
03/07/2025. Prior to this the last photograph was dated 03/16/2023.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was provided regarding the uploading of documents.
Two documents were completed but were not uploaded timely.
• The agency was informed that in place of signatures on the PATP, if it is
documented in the social work contacts that the worker reviewed the PATP
during a home visit and gave the caretaker a copy of the PATP that this would
meet the rule. The social work contact would need to specify that the worker
went over the PATP and the caregiver received a copy.
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The assessment did not
involve a review of a CAP as the agency was not cited for any rule violations
during the 2024 Interim audit. The assessment contained a thorough review of the
agency's ongoing efforts to comply with the rules. The assessment did not identify
any barriers which would negatively affect the agency's compliance with the rules.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and financial records were not available.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed report enjoying working for the agency. They remarked that the
administration is supportive and there is a strong supportive team at the agency.

Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern DHHS office in Bessemer. There is adequate
office space. All CHRI documents are uploaded into the CWLM system.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst generated one safety alert during her visits to the homes. The
safety alert is as follows:
Safety Alert #1. A safety alert was generated on 02/12/2025 as the home was
missing a smoke alarm between the child's bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 02/12/2025 as the smoke alarm was
installed and verifying photos provided and uploaded.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
May 6, 2025
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
